comment.author: 73199923@N00
comment._content: Nice match with 1865 photo: and 1957 photo

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I bet that is James Barnet (1827-1904), aged about 40, if these photos are c.1865. adb.anu.edu.au/biography/barnet-james-johnstone-2939 nla.gov.au/nla.pic-an23182639 See also - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/4312847312/]

comment.author: 73199923@N00
comment._content: Yes Barnet died in 1904 and is buried in the Presbyterian section of Rookwood Cemetery ! Looking closely you can see the bell ringing. The bell would ring out half an hour before departure so as to let mourners know to get back on the train or get left behind Nice history blog here pastlivesofthenearfuture.wordpress.com/2012/07/08/rookwoo...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/hpeters] Indeed! Here is a GoogleMapsSatelliteView showing the position of No.1 Station. If you then pull out a bit you can see the course of the old railway along what is now William Drive, Barnet (now there's a clue!) Avenue, and Memorial Avenue. (willing to be proved wrong by any cemetery railway buff)

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Here we go - the SLNSW has a Government Printing Office version of this photo attributed to Charles Pickering (photographer) and dated 17/3/1871 - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=412132 And several more in the series - trove.nla.gov.au/work/15614293?q=rookwood&c=picture

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: There is subsequent instance in 1872 of Charles Percy Pickering doing work for the NSW Government "under the direction of James Barnet Esq., Colonial Architect" (on the title page) in this wonderful album "Photographs of Public and Other Buildings" - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=442753 Included in that album is yet another photo of the "Mortuary Haslem Creek (south end)" with James Barnet dressed the same and others loitering awkwardly - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/ItemViewer.aspx?itemid=823409&am...

comment.author: 32162360@N00

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [3 months late] Brilliant to have found a photo of the sculptor!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] [Better late than never!] It is amazing what crops up on Flickr, waiting to be cross-referenced. Thomas Duckett obituary is worth a look too - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/13166461 - mention of several busts of famous people and "sculpuresque transparencies for the Museum windows" - presumably the Australian Museum in College Street?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Another picture of James Barnet in 1879, a few years later - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/4802367
